title.narrative: CPD Institutional Strengthening to Support Bangladeshs Dual Transition

description.narrative:
To increase awareness among stakeholders including policymakers on the pitfalls of Bangladesh’s dual graduation and necessary changes in policies, measures and operations to be required addressing those through independent research and participatory discussions
This project funding under the 2019 LGA frame is with the Centre for Policy Dialogue (CPD) to support the organization with core funding so that it can strengthen its capacity and conduct policy advocacy and dialogue, research, and participatory outreach in the context of Bangladesh’s ‘‘dual transition’’ in the coming years. The key result is ‘To ensure an inclusive and just society by addressing the pitfalls of Bangladesh’s dual graduation through research, policy dialogue and participatory outreach’. The indicators include: - Improvement in economic, social, environmental and governance indicators; - Institutional and regulatory reforms undertaken by Government of Bangladesh
